greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Integer values of sigma(n)/n that are prime.
comment: Subsequence of A054030 consisting of primes among the abundancies sigma(m)/m of multiply perfect numbers m (see A007691).
Each 2 corresponds to a perfect number A000396, so if there are infinitely many perfect numbers, then the sequence is infinite.
If, in addition, there are only finitely many multiply perfect numbers m with sigma(m)/m > 2 (see A134639), then a(n) = 2 for all n > some N.
reference: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, B2.
link: A. Flammenkamp, The Multiply Perfect Numbers Page
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Nov 22 2012
